actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1060.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #338 (359-4).
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Finance with amendment, S. Rept. 94-1349.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: An Act to exempt from duty certain aircraft components and materials installed in aircraft previously exported from the United States where the aircraft is returned without having been advanced in value or improved in condition while abroad.

summary.text: (Measure passed Senate) Provides under the Tariff Schedules of the United States that any aircraft previously (1) exported and composed at the time of such exportation in part of components and materials which are products of the United States and which were installed while the aircraft was within the United States; or (2) exported and returned to the United States without having been advanced in value or improved in condition while abroad and which was entered for consumption before 1970 pursuant to an entry which is unliquidated as of the date of enactment of this Act, shall be dutiable at the regular rate of duty appropriate to such aircraft provided for in the Tariff Schedules and assessed on the full value of such aircraft less the cost of U.S. components and materials at the time of installation including the cost of such installation.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Tariff Schedules of the United States to provide for a partial exemption from duty for articles previously exported from the United States composed in part of fabricated components the products of the United States, when returned after having been exported, without having been advanced in value or improved in condition while abroad.

An Act to exempt from duty certain aircraft components and materials installed in aircraft previously exported from the United States where the aircraft is returned without having been advanced in value or improved in condition while abroad.
